author: The Editorial Board
title: When T-Mobile Met Sprint
text:
On-again-off-again wireless couple Sprint and T-Mobile have agreed to a $26 billion merger, which by all indications would benefit customers and promote competition. Regulators broke up the union four years ago, but the Trump Administration should give its blessing.
The T-Mobile-Sprint deal would unite the U.S.â€™s third and fourth largest wireless carriers. With 100 million customers, the combined company would be able to go toe-to-toe with Verizon Wireless (116 million) and AT&T (93 million). Their combined LTE networks...
